lb-5kyj.title: Integration: connect evolution pipeline with visualization
lb-5kyj.description: Wire everything together: evolution runs in background, best players shown in visualization, generation stats displayed. Ensure the program compiles and runs on Linux.

lb-6ef4.title: Spaceship Duel Evolution System
lb-6ef4.description: Rust program that evolves AI combatants for a 1v1 spaceship duel game with Asteroids-style mechanics, genetic reinforcement learning, and real-time visualization

lb-8v89.title: Genome and AI behavior system
lb-8v89.description: Design and implement genome structure that encodes ship behavior. Map genome to decision-making: inputs (enemy position, bullet positions, own state) -> outputs (thrust, rotate, fire). Use a neural network or rule-based system.

lb-a1ly.title: Match system: game loop, win conditions, time limit
lb-a1ly.description: Implement match loop that runs a duel between two ships. Match ends when a ship is destroyed or time limit reached. Track match results.

lb-dmbs.title: Core game physics: ship movement, rotation, thrust, inertia, toroidal wrapping
lb-dmbs.description: Implement Ship struct with position, velocity, rotation, thrust-based movement with inertia, and 1000x1000 toroidal wrapping. Ships are triangles like Asteroids.

lb-kpm6.title: Evolutionary system: fitness, selection, crossover, mutation
lb-kpm6.description: Implement genetic algorithm: fitness evaluation from match results, tournament selection, crossover, mutation. Run many matches per generation. Evolution should produce increasingly competent fighters.

lb-l3v2.title: Parallelize match evaluation with rayon for faster evolution
lb-l3v2.description: The evaluate_generation function runs matches sequentially (1000 per generation). Parallelize using rayon to leverage multiple CPU cores, dramatically speeding up evolution so users see better-evolved AIs sooner.

lb-oha0.title: Clean up compiler warnings: remove unused code
lb-oha0.description: Remove dead code flagged by compiler warnings: unused method best() in evolution.rs, unused field distance_traveled in game.rs, unused methods normalize() and dot() in physics.rs

lb-sllx.title: Visualization: Asteroids-style rendering with real-time match viewing
lb-sllx.description: Render matches in real-time with Asteroids aesthetic (line graphics on dark background). Show ships as triangles, bullets as dots, arena boundaries. User can watch state-of-the-art evolved players competing.

lb-uv18.title: Enhance fitness function with proximity and engagement tracking
lb-uv18.description: Add proximity tracking to matches (closest approach, avg distance) and enhance fitness function to reward closing distance and facing the enemy. Currently there is no gradient signal for approach behavior, limiting evolution quality.

lb-vjw8.title: Projectile system: bullets, collision detection, bullet limits
lb-vjw8.description: Implement bullet firing, bullet travel (max 200px range), collision detection between bullets and ships, 8 bullets per round limit per ship.

lb-xkju.title: Add thrust flame and explosion effects to Asteroids-style rendering
lb-xkju.description: Add thrust exhaust flames (flickering triangle behind ship when thrusting) and explosion particle effects when ships are destroyed. These are iconic Asteroids visual elements that make evolved behaviors more readable.

lb-zww1.title: Project setup: Cargo.toml, dependencies, module structure
lb-zww1.description: Initialize Rust project with Cargo.toml, add core dependencies (macroquad for rendering, rand for RNG, serde for serialization), create module structure (game, physics, ai, evolution, render)
